required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluate the Transcatheter Artificial Aortic Valve and Transcatheter Artificial Heart Values Delivery System
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective, Multicenter, Single-armed Trial That Aims to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of Transcatheter Artificial Aortic Valve and Transcatheter Artificial Heart Values Delivery System

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to demonstrate that transcatheter artificial aortic valve and transcatheter artificial heart values delivery system is associated with a reduction of all-cause mortality in severe aortic stenosis or insufficiency patients who are high risk or ineligible for aortic valve replacement.

detailed_description.textblock:
Aortic valve diseases is usually caused by rheumatic fever, congenital aortic valve structural abnormality or degenerative aortic valve calcification. Transcatheter aortic valve implantation (TAVI) has evolved as an alternative to surgical aortic valve replacement (SAVR) with now more than 50,000 implantations in patients with symptomatic severe aortic stenosis, who were considered to be at very high or prohibitive operative risk.
This project take the incidence of all-cause mortality at 12 months since TAVI as the primary endpoint to evaluate the safety and efficacy, then take the procedure success rate, device success rate, incidence of severe adverse events, device operative performance, prosthetic valve performance and quality of life to evaluate transcatheter artificial aortic valve and transcatheter artificial heart values delivery system of Ningbo Jenscare Biotechnology Co., Ltd. in clinical application.

primary_outcome.description: Cumulative incidence of a combination of all cause death at 12 month after TAVI

secondary_outcome.description: Documentation of no death occurred during or within 72 hours after TAVI, no conversion to conventional cardiopulmonary bypass, the value was placed in the correct anatomical position and achieve the desired effect
Documentation of the device was implanted successfully, placed in the correct anatomical position and achieve the desired effect

secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the TAVI procedure and 3 days,7 days, 30 days, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months after TAVI
secondary_outcome.description: Documentation of the serious long-term complications, including mortality, stroke, transient ischemic stroke, myocardial infarction, dialysis and reinterventions

Using the following measure (loading and releasing properties of artificial aortic valve; pushing, emptying, withdrawing, developing performance, fracture of the delivery system) that can be converted to utilities using an algorithm. Utilities range from 1 to 3, with 3 representing perfect performance, and 1 corresponding to the worst performance state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months after TAVI
secondary_outcome.description: Using the following measures: effective orifice area (EOA)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months after TAVI
secondary_outcome.description: Using the following measures: transvalvular mean gradient

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation and improvement of quality of life
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Preoperative and 30 days, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months after TAVI
secondary_outcome.description: Measures 5 domains (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) that can be converted to utilities using an algorithm. Utilities range from 0 to 1, with 1 representing perfect health, and 0 corresponding to the worst imaginable health state.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months after TAVI
secondary_outcome.description: Using the following measures: peak flow velocity

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months after TAVI
secondary_outcome.description: Using the following measures: degree of aortic valve regurgitation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: 30 days, 3 months, 6 months, 12 months after TAVI
secondary_outcome.description: Using the following measures: degree of perivalvular leakage

arm_group.description: Patients undergoing a Jenscare TAVI and delivery system

intervention.description: Jenscare TAVI and delivery system will implant a percutaneous bioprosthesis value, which is positioned in the native aortic valve, plays a role to control blood flow, and help your heart to work better. It may also shorten your recovery time to getting back to everyday activities.
